Title: Store Manager - Joss & Main
RoleDescription:
Location: 19 Oakbrook Center, Oak Brook, IL 60523
The salary range for this position is $75,000 - $84,000 however, base pay offered may vary depending on job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. Bonuses may be provided as part of the compensation package, in addition to a full range of medical, financial, and/or other benefits, depending on the position. 
Brief Overview of Position:
Come join the team that is reinventing home! We are hiring a Store Manager for our Joss & Main retail store! If you are looking for rapid growth, constant learning and dynamic challenges, this store might be the future home for your career.
What youll do:

As an authentic brand ambassador for the Wayfair family, lead and create a best in class customer experience by connecting them with the world's biggest and best home online assortment brought to life in our stores.
Master our brand story and be able to share our brand with polished communication and professionalism.
Handle impromptu visitation from the press, investors or other key stakeholders.
Provide leadership to the team and meet or exceed budgeted sales, payroll, and controllable expense goals.
Maintain leadership presence through effective floor management and resource allocation.
Ignite an on-brand design space utilizing all of our design and omni-channel tools and services to bring our customers design aspirations to life.
Guide customers through their questions on product features and functionality, style and product coordination, and cutting requests, including in-store assortment and endless aisle.
Motivate and train all associates in sales, customer service, operations, and product knowledge, utilizing all resources.
Lead the use of utilization design tools, CRM software and client accounts for consistent customer experience and record keeping.  
Foster and instill a culture of accountability and continuous feedback to promote a profitable, positive, and dynamic environment.
Consistently recruit, hire, and retain a salesforce that delights and inspires our customers while driving sales and providing design advice.
Identify talents and develop skills within the team to enable succession planning.
Perform opening and closing routines and provide supervision to ensure the store is meeting financial goals and associates are providing best in class service to our customers. 
Effectively manage store operations, maintain appropriate inventory levels, and maintain visual merchandising standards.
Utilize sales analytics tools to drive store profitability and growth in a way that supports the success of the overall brand.
Develop, lead, and deliver a long-term sustainable plan for growth, visitation and profitability in the market.
Outreach and prospect new B2C and B2B clientele. 
Create and host in-store, on premise, and community outreach events.
Lead a team to always use good judgment by demonstrating a culture of ethical conduct, security, and compliance.
Champion and campaign for a resolution oriented environment for your team.
Identify and share opportunities to innovate, improve, and simplify processes to ensure operational excellence.
Know and assess the competition and retail evolution by leveraging insights and feedback to deliver results.
Live by, emulate, and guide by our People Principles daily. 

What youll need:

5+ years of management experience in a specialty retail and/or multi-unit retail business environment.  Interior design, furniture or home goods experience preferred.
Exceptional analytical, problem-solving and decision-making skills.
Proven ability to motivate, influence and inspire yourself and others.
Track record of thriving in a fast paced and changing environment.
Technical acumen to learn necessary software; experience with Google Cloud G Suite, including Docs, Sheets, Slides, and Forms preferred.
Ability to process information and merchandise through a computer system and POS register system. 
Full time associates may need to work nights, weekends, and holidays on a rotating basis. 

Essential Functions:

On-site presence at a physical location.
Excellent verbal communication skills.
Excellent active listening skills.
Excellent sales and customer service skills.
Extensive knowledge of the merchandise sold.

Physical Requirements:

While performing the duties of this job, the employee is frequently required to stand, walk, talk and hear. The employee frequently is required to handle, or feel and reach with hands and arms. The employee is occasionally required to sit; regularly climb or balance; and frequently stoop, kneel, crouch, or crawl. The employee must regularly, frequently or occasionally lift and/or move up to 50 lbs.

Title: Manager, Supplier Onboarding Operations
RoleDescription:
Wayfair is the destination for all things home and a place that helps everyone, anywhere, create their feeling of home. Through technology and innovation, we make it possible for shoppers to quickly and easily find exactly what they want from a selection of more than 33 million items across home furnishings, dcor, home improvement, housewares, and 23,000 Suppliers, and we served 24 million customers in 2021 alone. 
For this role within our Global Partner Support organization, you will be part of the Get Started and Grow team that closely partners with Tech, Operations, and Commercial teams to improve supplier onboarding experience and unlock business growth for new Suppliers. Your core focus will be to drive improvements in product, process, and analytics with those teams and other stakeholders that will lead to improved customer experience, enhanced supplier support, and potentially deliver positive financial impact. We are looking for highly motivated and detailed-oriented individuals with a global mindset to help expand this space within the global supply chain industry.
Your Role and Expectations:

Collaborate cross functionally on a global scale with product, engineering, operations, and commercial teams to deliver a foundational analytical framework, while providing near term analysis to continuously improve business impact and experience for our customers and suppliers.
Perform deep-dive analysis on business impact, supplier/customer experience KPIs by leveraging analytics (SQL) to identify root causes behind performance issues and drive decision-making process at all levels (strategic, operational, tactical) through impact sizing, cost-benefit analysis, risk assessment, and other informed decision making methodologies
Communicate findings with a succinct point of view and utilize compelling visualization tools (e.g. Looker, Data Studio, Tableau, etc.) to both the executive level and cross-functional teams; ensuring that these insights drive our strategies to deliver business impact.
Work closely with Data Engineering and Analytics teams to build data warehouses / data layers and visualizations for both process health monitoring and executive level KPI reporting
Analyze large and complex datasets, answer ambiguous questions, and develop recommendations to guide business decisions with senior leadership
Partner with business and engineering stakeholders at various levels to identify key factors and requirements for each initiative, secure the neccessary buy-in from leadership for project methodology, and build a 6-12 month roadmap with clear goals and milestones

What You'll Need 

Bachelors degree in Business, Supply Chain/Operations, or Engineering discipline
5+ years of analytical experience in operations, retail, engineering, consulting, strategy or finance
Advanced experience with Microsoft Excel or Google Sheets, SQL or GBQ, and data visualization tools such as Google Data Studio (Looker, Tableau, or PowerBI)
Familiarity with Python or R is preferred but not required
Experience working in a program/project management setting with high attention to detail and proven ability to manage multiple, competing priorities simultaneously
Solid technical understanding of how tech stack (various architectures/frameworks, databases, cloud / data infrastructure, microservices, code repositories, prod/dev environments, etc.) work in enterprise and commercial software
Strong written and verbal communication skill with a focus on stakeholder management experience

Title: Manager, Operations Business Analytics
RoleDescription:
At this time, Wayfair does not provide sponsorship for employment authorization for this position.
At Wayfair, were building industry-shaping Operations infrastructure and capabilities to fuel growth and delight our customers. Were seeking bright, curious, and high-energy project managers to execute strategic initiatives that will propel Wayfair to $20B in sales and beyond.
Returns and Incident Prevention is a key priority for our business. We know that customers dont always love the product they receive or that issues can arise throughout an order. Our goal is to prevent these returns & incidents proactively in the supply chain to drive customer happiness and reduce financial exposure, contributing to the companys overall profitability and growth. Our team works with counterparts across Fulfillment Centers, Home Delivery Operations, Product, Finance, Transportation Logistics and Process Definition teams to drive new approaches and processes that deliver profitability and customer experience improvements. This work is broad, business critical, complex and highly cross-functional. 
We are looking for a data-driven and impact-oriented person to drive an incident prevention roadmap within the supply chain that delivers on these objectives. The ideal candidate must be a highly flexible and hands on leader who understands how to effectively drive results in a fast-paced and rapidly growing company.
What You'll Do

Cultivate and drive a strategic roadmap of cross-functional initiatives intended to reduce incidents happening within the supply chain. This will include discovery, prioritization, and program management of new initiatives across supply chain, tech.
Lead a team of 1-2 analysts to drive programs and strategy
Partner cross-functionally with groups company-wide, including Product, Finance, Fulfillment Centers, Industrial Engineering, Transportation to drive alignment and execution against innovative solutions to challenging commercial problems intended to reduce financial incident exposure and drive customer happiness
Understand strategic business goals and deliver innovative strategies and solutions for achieving those goals and navigating roadblocks.
Analyze and report out on performance, clearly articulate successes and opportunities to senior leadership.
Travel to Wayfair warehouse operations (<10%) and build relationships with operational partners.
Contribute to the development of tools and processes that drive efficiencies for the team and simplify the day-to-day operations.
Be a great teammate! We seek candidates with a positive attitude, collaborative spirit, passion for solving problems, and a sense of humor.

What You'll Need

4+ years total work experience, with previous experience in e-commerce, supply chain, reverse logistics, retail management, finance, or management consulting preferred. 
A graduate degree in business or a technical field is welcome, but not required. 
Strong expertise in analytics and tools to understand root cause & drive solution forward. Including but not limited to analyzing large data sets and using that analysis to drive business plans and priorities with deep SQL, Google Big Query, and dashboard creation capabilities.
Evidence of scrappy-startup-execution and a track record of taking on ambiguous, big challenges and delivering despite obstacles, limited resources, or landscape ambiguity.
Senior presence; able to clearly and consistently work side-by-side with a broad range of senior and cross-functional leaders to achieve objectives.
Articulate and persuasive communication skills, both written and verbal.
An inclusive and open leadership style.
Ability to manage and prioritize projects, and to delegate tasks appropriately.
Comfortable with managing ambiguous problems, applying data-driven frameworks to drive a roadmap to tackle opportunities and track record of execution against roadmap.
Innovative problem-solving skills  dissect and determine root causes of problems and implement solutions.
Experiencing navigating complex organizational structures and multiple stakeholders
An ability to hit the ground running  a confident, entrepreneurial self-starter.

Committed to delighting its customers every step of the way, Wayfair is reinventing the way people shop for their homes - from product discovery to final delivery.

We're not just a team; we're a dynamic, international force powered by creativity, deep consumer knowledge, and relentless ambition. Own the strategy, execution and optimization for Major Campaigns across our European websites, both B2B and B2C
Manage a small team to drive operational implementation on a bi-weekly basis, incl. impact reporting. 

Oversee the end to end execution of all EU major shopping holidays, including marketing channel coordination, pricing and profit alignment, executional timelines, tooling, product selection, and more.

Bachelors degree in business, marketing or another quantitative field of study (e.g., sciences, engineering, economics). Masters degree is a plus

B2B

The Data Integrations & Analytics teams leverage Big Data to optimize internal merchandising processes. Together, these teams deliver on key merchandising goals. 
Category Management
The Category Management team drives strategy for Wayfairs product categories through tight internal and external partnership. We serve as ambassadors of the product categories we manage. We are at the forefront as Wayfair redefines the supplier experience as a platform, giving suppliers more data, more transparency, and more control while retaining the high-touch elements that make working with Wayfair exceptional. Internally, we leverage a diverse set of cross-functional partners to execute our strategic vision. In a role on the Category Management team, you will be expected to define overarching goals and strategy within your category, problem-solve, articulate and execute against tactical plans, and manage key business metrics. Members of the team must be able to expertly negotiate internally and externally, while also being effective project managers.

Our Merchandising Compliance team is responsible for keeping our customers safe, and our products, services and offerings in compliance with applicable federal or local regulations. If youre passionate about driving business impact by working cross functionally, love working through complex operations decisions, and thrive in a dynamic, entrepreneurial environment, then this is the perfect opportunity for you.
North America/Europe Retail Tech Analytics 
The North America/Europe Retail Tech Analytics Team empowers stakeholders across the Global Supplier Organization, enabling teams to grow their businesses. As an associate you would help streamline processes, organize internal and external communication with regard to program updates, new tools, etc, and work closely with data to draw conclusions and influence stakeholders.
Perigold 
Perigold is Wayfairs newest brand, targeting the luxury home market. We are focused on providing an unparalleled assortment of luxury home goods through an elevated online shopping experience for our customers. We do this by connecting the best brands with our luxury customers while working on product curation, brand marketing and storytelling, building a best-in-class site experience, and providing best-in-class service and delivery. We serve as ambassadors for the categories we manage by identifying and solving unique customer and supplier challenges. Internally, we partner with various teams including Profit Management, Merchandising, Partner Operations, Marketing, Brand and Curated Merchandising and Promotions to bring the Perigold vision to life.

Title: Luxury Brand Manager, Perigold
RoleDescription:
Perigold is seeking a Brand Manager to join the Perigold Marketing team. In this role, youll be responsible for ensuring brand integrity and consistency across the entire consumer journey to drive consideration, recall, and awareness. Youll develop a deep understanding of the Perigold customer (B2C and B2B), the competitive landscape, and the core brand offering to inform creative briefs, marketing plans and drive best-in-class execution. Youll oversee how the Perigold brand comes to life across key initiatives, including loyalty programs, B2B, and prospecting across the Wayfair family of brands.
This role is based in Boston (4 days in office) and reports to Perigolds Chief Marketing Officer,  with significant cross-functional exposure across our Marketing, Retail, Content, Creative, and Category Management teams.
What Youll Do

Own the brand strategy with the CMO and manage its execution and consistency across customer touch points, inclusive of both B2C and B2B and across the Wayfair Family of Brands
Develop, test, and measure Perigolds B2B marketing strategy, in partnership with the B2B CMO and Marketing teams
Own Perigolds loyalty strategy, inclusive of launch strategy, execution, and ongoing management and measurement
Centralize and evangelize consumer insights, including management of annual Brand Health survey through our external insights vendor
Ensure Brand Communications Calendar reflects a cohesive cross-channel strategy, inclusive of brand and merchandising priorities; work with cross-channel partners to bring to life through GTM process
Partner with Performance Marketing lead and Integrated Marketing Analyst to concept, execute, and measure integrated Brand Campaigns
Partner with marketing channels and Creative teams to ensure brand positioning is effectively integrated into all creative assets
Manages a team of 3 direct reports, including oversight of Promotions & Offers, Supplier Marketing & Advertising, and Curation
Oversee our Supplier Marketing and Advertising function, ensuring our strategy to market our supplier brands ladders up to overall Brand Strategy and maximizes monetization potential 
Oversee our Promotions function, including promotional calendar and campaign execution and measurement
Oversee Curation, ensuring our product curations in marketing and onsite events reflect our SOV priorities and storytelling goals

What Youll Need

5+ years of experience working in brand marketing in a consumer brand, agency, and/or consulting capacity 
Luxury retail experience highly preferred 
A deep understanding of and curiosity about consumer behavior
Demonstrated balance of being highly analytical and originally creative
Critical thinking including the ability to break down complex ideas and generate insights and solutions or strategically build a story from large data sets
Excellent interpersonal skills and ability to influence senior-level and cross-functional stakeholders 
Ability to communicate a high-level brand vision as well as give tactical creative feedback
Strong verbal and written skills including distilling data into compelling, insight-led presentations
Superb project management skills including the ability to work on multiple projects at once
An ownership mindset with the ability to streamline processes and thrive in a highly ambiguous and fast-paced environment with a get stuff done attitude
Collaborative team player who wants to see the whole team succeed and thrive
Familiarity with the latest market trends and best practices especially as it relates to the target consumer
